identificationModule.briefTitle: Teneteplase Reperfusion Therapy in Acute Ischemic Cerebrovascular Events-III
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 3, Multicenter, Prospective, Randomized, Open Label, Blinded-endpoint (PROBE) Controlled Trial of Recombinant Human TNK Tissue-type Plasminogen Activator (rhTNK-tPA) for Injection Versus Standard Medical Treatment for Acute Ischemic Stroke Due to Large Vessel Occlusion With Perfusion Mismatch up to 24 Hours of Symptom Onset

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The trial is a multicenter, prospective, block randomized, open label, blinded-endpoint (PROBE) controlled design. Patients with acute ischemic stroke due to large vessel occlusion within 4.5-24 hours of symptom onset (including wake-up stroke and unwitnessed stroke) will be randomized 1:1 to 0.25mg/kg intravenous tenecteplase or standard medical treatment.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The study will be a multicenter, prospective, randomized, open label, blinded-endpoint (PROBE), controlled phase 3 trial (2 arms with 1:1 randomization) in ischemic stroke due to large vessel occlusion with perfusion mismatch up to 24 hours of symptom onset. The target mismatch profiles on CTP or MRI perfusion weighted imaging include ischemic core volume \<70 mL, mismatch ratio≥1.8 and mismatch volume≥15 mL demonstrated by a certified automatic software. The sample size is 516 patients.

armGroups.label: rhTNK-tPA ( 0.25 mg/kg, Max 25 mg )
armGroups.description: rhTNK-tPA ( 0.25 mg/kg ) is given as a single, intravenous bolus ( within 5-10 seconds ) immediately upon randomization. Maximum dose 25mg.

armGroups.label: standard medical treatment
armGroups.description: Aspirin combined with clopidogrel, aspirin alone, or clopidogrel alone after randomization at the discretion of local neurologists

interventions.name: standard medical treatment
interventions.description: Aspirin combined with clopidogrel, aspirin alone, or clopidogrel alone are being used.

primaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of excellent functional outcome defined as an mRS score ≤ 1 at 90 days

secondaryOutcomes.description: Ordinal distribution of mRS at 90 days.
Proportion of favorable functional outcome defined by an mRS score ≤ 2 point at 90 days
Clinical response rate at 72 hours defined by an improvement on NIHSS score ≥8 points compared with the initial deficit or a score ≤1.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The rate of improvement on reperfusion
secondaryOutcomes.description: The rate of improvement on reperfusion at 24 hours (improved by 90% on Tmax\>6s)
NIHSS change from baseline at 7 days
Proportion of symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage (sICH) within 36 hours (as defined by The European Cooperative Acute Stroke Study III criteria \[ECASSIII\])
Rate of death from any cause within 90 days
Rate of systematic bleeding at 90 days ( as defined by The Global Utilisation of Streptokinase and Tissue Plasminogen Activator for Occluded Coronary Arteries \[GUSTO\]: moderate and severe bleeding)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Adverse events ( AEs ) / serious adverse events ( SAEs )
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rate of adverse events ( AEs ) / serious adverse events ( SAEs ) within 90 days

locations.facility: Beijing Tiantan Hospital, Capital Medical University
